title: Love Island: First look at the winter edition is revealed as Labour MP shares behind-the-scenes snap
text:
Fans are eagerly anticipating the inaugural winter edition of Love Island, set to air in January 2020.

And a first look at the ITV2 dating series has been revealed as Labour MP Andrew Gwynne shared a behind-the-scenes snap from the show's Salford auditions on Twitter last month.

In the image, the unlikely fan, 45, pulled an animated facial expression as he captured a glimpse of potential female contestants waiting to try out for a role in the competition at ITV's MediaCityUK centre in Greater Manchester.

'Heaven or hell?' A first look at Love Island has been revealed as Labour MP Andrew Gwynne shared a behind-the-scenes snap from the show's Salford auditions on Twitter last month

The politician cheekily captioned the photo: 'Heaven or Hell? Arrive at ITV @MediaCityUK to the joys of @LoveIsland auditions!' Applications for the smash hit series are currently open until November 30.

In August, it emerged that Love Island chiefs are on the hunt for Essex lads, goths and twins to complete the line-up.

Bosses are apparently working super hard to ensure the next crop of celebrity wannabes are full of personality in a bid to impress viewers.

Upcoming: Fans are eagerly anticipating the inaugural winter edition of Love Island, set to air in January 2020 with host Caroline Flack

Set to cause a stir, the ex lover of Katie Price has reportedly signed up to star in the spin-off.

The Sun recently claimed Charles Drury, 22, has been in talks to appear in the upcoming series and could prove to be TV gold as insiders hope he'll spill secrets on former glamour model Katie, 41, and their short fling.

The builder is said to have been on Love Island bosses' radar since last year but was dating someone so was ruled out of the matchmaking series.

Looking for love? Set to cause a stir, the ex lover of Katie Price, Charles Drury, has reportedly signed up to star in the spin-off

Famous ex: The former glamour model, 41, and Charles, 22, were reportedly introduced by a builder working on Katie's mansion, who encouraged her to follow Charles on social media

Jay Munro, a former footballer turned model and Instagram sensation, has also caught the eye of bosses according to the Daily Star.

The Scottish hunk went viral in Australia this summer when he became known as the 'hot door pusher' on The Voice, and now could be making a name for himself on UK screens.

A source said: 'Jay will be the one all the girls will be chasing. Just like Tommy Fury, he's a sportsman, in good shape and has dreamy looks.'

Headed for the villa: Former footballer turned model and social media star Jay Munro has also caught the eye of ITV bosses, according to reports
description: The unlikely fan, 45, shared a behind-the-scenes snap from the show's Salford auditions for the January series on Twitter last month.
